text: Palmira is a district of the Cañas canton, in the Guanacaste province of Costa Rica. == History == Palmira was created on 30 November 1995 by Decreto Ejecutivo 24809-G. Segregated from Cañas. == Geography == Palmira has an area of km² and an elevation of metres. ==Villages== Administrative center of the district is the village of Palmira. Other villages in the district are Aguacaliente, Paraíso (partly), San Isidro (partly), Santa Lucía (partly) and Tenorio. == Demographics == For the 2011 census, Palmira had a population of inhabitants. == Transportation == === Road transportation === The district is covered by the following road routes: *25px National Route 6 *25px National Route 927 == References == Category:Districts of Guanacaste Province Category:Populated places in Guanacaste Province
title: Palmira District, Cañas
